item.title: Protests in Johannesburg over 'racist' H&M ad
item.description: South African police Saturday intervened to clear protesters trashing outlets of Swedish clothing giant Hennes and Mauritz in Johannesburg over a controversial advertisement featuring a black child.

item.title: 'Record amount' of narcotics seized in Uppsala
item.description: Swedish police confiscated a record quantity of narcotics, thought to exceed half a tonne in weight, in two residential areas of Uppsala on Friday night.

item.title: Swedish police detain 15 at neo-Nazi gathering in Gothenburg
item.description: 15 people from the neo-Nazi organisation Nordic Resistance Movement (Nordiska Motståndsrörelsen, NMR) as well as two counter-demonstrators have been taken in by police in Gothenburg.

item.title: Why Swedish Christmas has only just ended
item.description: Many people in Sweden will finally throw out Christmas trees and clear up the last of their festive decorations on January 13th.

item.title: 'When a US president speaks about Sweden, the fallout can last a long time'
item.description: In an extract from his new book Good Sweden, Bad Sweden, The Local's Paul Rapacioli explains how Donald Trump wasn't the first US president to malign Sweden.

item.title: The Local's Swedish word of the week – part 11
item.description: Every week we ask a Swede, or a foreigner in Sweden, to explain their favourite word. Watch the video below and click here to learn more about the Swedish language.

item.title: Knife attack at Gothenburg supermarket leaves one injured
item.description: A man has been left with serious injuries after a knife attack at a supermarket in eastern Gothenburg.

item.title: Sex offender convicted after getting caught with child on train in Sweden
item.description: A man was sentenced on Friday to two-and-a-half years in prison for sex offences against children, after a train attendant alerted officers to his suspicious behaviour.

item.title: Swedish contraception app reported after dozens fall pregnant
item.description: A Swedish contraception app has been reported to authorities after 37 users got pregnant and had abortions.

item.title: Why Swedish cartoon hero Bamse appeared in a US Senate report
item.description: One of Sweden's most popular cartoon characters for over 50 years, Bamse the bear has now made perhaps his most unlikely appearance ever – in a US Senate report on Vladimir Putin’s "assault on democracy".

item.title: Sweden’s Armed Forces had a shortage of new troops in 2017
item.description: The number of people who signed up for the Swedish Armed Forces in 2017 fell below the required target.

item.title: Sami villages ask for emergency support as ice blocks reindeer from food
item.description: Several Sami villages have applied for emergency assistance to help their reindeer, as the layer of ice under the snow makes it difficult for the animals to find food in northern Sweden.

item.title: Assange becomes Ecuadorian citizen five years after fleeing Sweden probe
item.description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has become a citizen of Ecuador more than five years after moving into its London embassy to escape arrest over a Swedish rape investigation that he claims is linked to his whistle-blowing activities.

item.title: Recipe: How to make Swedish potato and celeriac gratin
item.description: This tasty dish is a variation on the classic Swedish potato gratin. Food writer John Duxbury shares his recipe.

item.title: French prosecutors push for Ikea trial over spying charges
item.description: French prosecutors are pushing for Ikea France and 15 people, including police officials, to be put on trial on charges of spying on employees and customers, a source close to the inquiry said on Thursday.

item.title: Does Sweden's tax system really screw the rich?
item.description: People tend to believe two things about Swedish taxes: firstly, that they are extremely high and, secondly, that Swedes pay them readily because of the high level of public services they receive in return and their commitment to the welfare state.

item.title: Stockholm's Vasa Museum sails into top spot on most-visited list
item.description: Stockholm's Vasa Museum, showcasing a well-preserved centuries-old shipwreck, is now the country’s most visited museum.

item.title: Ikea causes stir by asking customers to pee on their new ad
item.description: Swedish furniture giant Ikea made international headlines after asking customers to urinate on their new print advert if they want a discount when buying a crib.

item.title: Swedish unemployment drops in 2017
item.description: Unemployment in Sweden continued to decline during 2017, according to new stats from the Swedish Public Employment Service (Arbetsförmedlingen).

item.title: Almost half of Swedes think racism will increase in the country
item.description: Almost half of Swedes surveyed in a new study said they think racism will grow in the country over the coming year, while a similar amount said they had witnessed it in the 12 months before.
